{"step_by_step_thinking": "A bloody tap during amniocentesis refers to the presence of blood in the amniotic fluid sample. This can affect the measurement of certain substances in the fluid. The L/S ratio (Lecithin/Sphingomyelin ratio) and the presence of Phosphatidyl glycerol are both used to assess lung maturity, and these can be affected by a bloody tap. Bilirubin, measured by DOD 450, is used to assess the risk of fetal anemia and can also be affected by a bloody tap. However, α-fetoprotein, a protein produced by the fetus, is not affected by a bloody tap.", "answer_choice": "C. α-fetoprotein"}
